payload.instructions:
# Agent Instructions

- At the start of each new conversation, open and summarize `NEXT_STEPS.md` before taking any action.


## Skills
These skills are discovered at startup from multiple local sources. Each entry includes a name, description, and file path so you can open the source for full instructions.
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: /home/deck/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: /home/deck/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
- Discovery: Available skills are listed in project docs and may also appear in a runtime "## Skills" section (name + description + file path). These are the sources of truth; skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Description as trigger: The YAML `description` in `SKILL.md` is the primary trigger signal; rely on it to decide applicability. If unsure, ask a brief clarification before proceeding.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deeply nested references; prefer one-hop files explicitly linked from `SKILL.md`.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

content.text:
# AGENTS.md instructions for /home/deck

<INSTRUCTIONS>
# Agent Instructions

- At the start of each new conversation, open and summarize `NEXT_STEPS.md` before taking any action.


## Skills
These skills are discovered at startup from multiple local sources. Each entry includes a name, description, and file path so you can open the source for full instructions.
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: /home/deck/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: /home/deck/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
- Discovery: Available skills are listed in project docs and may also appear in a runtime "## Skills" section (name + description + file path). These are the sources of truth; skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Description as trigger: The YAML `description` in `SKILL.md` is the primary trigger signal; rely on it to decide applicability. If unsure, ask a brief clarification before proceeding.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deeply nested references; prefer one-hop files explicitly linked from `SKILL.md`.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.
</INSTRUCTIONS>

add https://github.com/realagiorganization/thinkpadkali1dotfiles as submodule, use ssh tho. add recursive submodule checkout as necessary step into makefile and AGENTS.md . summarize its functinality in SKILLS.md file with references on the submodule components that provide description of disovery of specfic components. add makefile command and github action with vhs tape and second gif in the readme for running full discovery using thinkpadkali1dotfiles submodule. commit and push

Output:
# Next Steps

## Current state
- GitHub Actions/VHS workflow added; pushes work when DNS resolves `github.com`.
- Local Actions runner uses `act` via Makefile, but installation failed because DNS could not resolve `github.com`.
- `.actrc` added with default platform mapping for `act`.
- Latest commits are local and not pushed due to intermittent DNS failures.

## What to do next
1) Restore DNS/network so `github.com` resolves.
2) Run:
   - `make actions-install`
   - `make actions-list`
   - `make actions-test`
   - `make actions-vhs`
3) Push: `git push -u origin main`

## Notes
- If `act` install succeeds, the Makefile targets should work as-is.
- The VHS workflow will generate `assets/archlinux-kde.gif` and auto-commit it via GitHub Actions.

ACT ?= act
ACT_FLAGS ?=
ACT_PLATFORMS ?= -P ubuntu-latest=ghcr.io/catthehacker/ubuntu:act-latest

.PHONY: actions-install actions-list actions-test actions-vhs actions-run

actions-install:
	./scripts/install-act.sh

actions-list:
	$(ACT) -l

actions-test:
	$(ACT) -n -W .github/workflows/vhs.yml $(ACT_PLATFORMS) $(ACT_FLAGS)

actions-vhs:
	$(ACT) -W .github/workflows/vhs.yml -j record $(ACT_PLATFORMS) $(ACT_FLAGS)

actions-run: actions-vhs

# deck0_dotfiles

[![VHS](https://github.com/realagiorganization/deck0_dotfiles/actions/workflows/vhs.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/realagiorganization/deck0_dotfiles/actions/workflows/vhs.yml)

This repository captures the files created or touched during the RDP setup and desktop customization.

## Demo (Arch Linux + KDE)
![Arch Linux KDE demo](assets/archlinux-kde.gif)

## RDP setup
- [RDP_CAVEATS.md](RDP_CAVEATS.md)

## Plasma (KDE)

payload.text:
**Adding git submodule and related updates**

I’m preparing to add a git submodule via SSH, likely under the root directory with the name thinkpadkali1dotfiles. I’ll update .gitmodules, create a Makefile target to handle recursive submodule checkouts, and update AGENTS.md to document this step. I also plan to add a new SKILLS.md summarizing the submodule’s discovery features and check existing GitHub workflows to add a VHS tape demo with a second GIF for running discovery using the submodule. Time to inspect the submodule contents and workflows!

summary.text:
**Adding git submodule and related updates**

I’m preparing to add a git submodule via SSH, likely under the root directory with the name thinkpadkali1dotfiles. I’ll update .gitmodules, create a Makefile target to handle recursive submodule checkouts, and update AGENTS.md to document this step. I also plan to add a new SKILLS.md summarizing the submodule’s discovery features and check existing GitHub workflows to add a VHS tape demo with a second GIF for running discovery using the submodule. Time to inspect the submodule contents and workflows!

.github/workflows/vhs.yml

Exit code: 0
Wall time: 0.1 seconds
Output:
name: VHS

on:
  push:
    paths:
      - ".github/workflows/vhs.yml"
      - ".github/vhs/archlinux-kde.tape"
      - "Dockerfile.archlinux"
      - "README.md"
      - "assets/**"
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  record:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

      - name: Build Arch Linux KDE image (cached)
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: .
          file: Dockerfile.archlinux
          load: true
          tags: deck0:ci
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Record demo with VHS
        uses: charmbracelet/vhs-action@v2
        with:
          tape: .github/vhs/archlinux-kde.tape

      - name: Commit updated GIF
        uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v5
        with:
          commit_message: "Update VHS recording"
          file_pattern: assets/archlinux-kde.gif

payload.text:
**Planning submodule integration and workflow updates**

I’m preparing to add a new git submodule and update the Makefile with targets to initialize submodules and run discovery workflows using that submodule. I’ll also create SKILLS.md summarizing discovery features from the submodule, update AGENTS.md and README with instructions and new demo gifs, and set up a GitHub Action using vhs tape for automated discovery that runs inside a container. I need to inspect the submodule’s scripts to finalize commands and references.

I need to inspect the submodule’s scripts to finalize commands and references.

# thinkpadkali1dotfiles

[![CI](https://github.com/realagiorganization/thinkpadkali1dotfiles/actions/workflows/tests.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/realagiorganization/thinkpadkali1dotfiles/actions/workflows/tests.yml)
[![LaTeX docs](https://github.com/realagiorganization/thinkpadkali1dotfiles/actions/workflows/latex.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/realagiorganization/thinkpadkali1dotfiles/actions/workflows/latex.yml)

Repository for discovery and Proxmox inventory helpers on this host.

## Key Files
- .bashrc — shell config with unlimited history enabled.
- .gitignore — allowlist-based ignore rules; only agent-managed files are tracked.
- [`AGENTS.md`](AGENTS.md) — concise agent instructions; see also [`AGENTS.md.d/`](AGENTS.md.d/) for playbooks.
- [`AGENTS.md.d/checking-discovered-proxmox-hosts-vms-and-lxcs.md`](AGENTS.md.d/checking-discovered-proxmox-hosts-vms-and-lxcs.md) — workflow for probing hosts and enumerating Proxmox VMs/LXCs.
- [`DISCOVERY.md`](DISCOVERY.md) — log of discovered hosts and evidence sources.
- [`DISCOVERY.md.d/checking.md`](DISCOVERY.md.d/checking.md) — reachability check log for known hosts.
- [`DISCOVERY_VMS.md`](DISCOVERY_VMS.md) — accumulated Proxmox VM/LXC inventories.
- [`DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS.md`](DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS.md) — snapshot of guest IPs and open ports with protocol-ready URLs.
- [`DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md`](DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md) — snapshot of captured VM screenshots.
- [`DISCOVERY_STORAGES.md`](DISCOVERY_STORAGES.md) — storage/mount details per host.
- [`DISCOVERY_ISOS.md`](DISCOVERY_ISOS.md) — image file discoveries (ISO/IMG/QCOW/VMDK/VDI) per host.
- [`discovery_vms_screenshots/`](discovery_vms_screenshots/) — saved VM screenshot assets.
- [`HISTORY.codex.md`](HISTORY.codex.md) — grouped Codex request history (requests only).
- [`scripts/check_hosts.sh`](scripts/check_hosts.sh) — entrypoint to check host reachability and gather Proxmox inventory; supports overrides via `CHECK_HOSTS`, `SSH_BIN`, `SSH_OPTS`, and `DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH`.
- [`scripts/inventory_proxmox.sh`](scripts/inventory_proxmox.sh) — invoked per host to detect Proxmox and list VMs/LXCs.
- [`scripts/capture_vm_screenshots.sh`](scripts/capture_vm_screenshots.sh) — captures Proxmox VM screenshots and appends them to the screenshot log.
- [`scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh`](scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh) — scans running guests for IPs/open TCP ports (nmap top ports) and writes `DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS.md`.
- [`scripts/discover_storages.sh`](scripts/discover_storages.sh) — collects `df`, `lsblk`, and `pvesm status` (when available) per host.
- [`scripts/discover_isos.sh`](scripts/discover_isos.sh) — searches common paths for image files with configurable roots and depth.
- [`scripts/tmux_gamepad_control.py`](scripts/tmux_gamepad_control.py) — optional tmux helper to drive pane/window navigation via an Xbox-style gamepad (requires `python3-evdev`; prefers `TMUX_GAMEPAD_PY=$HOME/.venvs/tmux-gamepad/bin/python3` when present).
- [`scripts/mock/ssh`](scripts/mock/ssh) — mock SSH binary used in CI to emulate Proxmox responses.
- [`.github/workflows/tests.yml`](.github/workflows/tests.yml) — CI that exercises scripts in a mocked environment.
- [`media/check_hosts.gif`](media/check_hosts.gif) — VHS-style capture (mocked run) of the host check workflow.
- [`docs/REPO_OVERVIEW.md`](docs/REPO_OVERVIEW.md) — repository map, script/env matrix, build/CI notes.
- [`docs/repo_guide.tex`](docs/repo_guide.tex) / [`docs/repo_guide.pdf`](docs/repo_guide.pdf) — condensed visual guide to the repo, builds via `make pdfs`.
- [`docs/transmission_credentials.md`](docs/transmission_credentials.md) — Transmission LXC RPC endpoint, credentials, queue limits, and mount paths.

## Usage
- Run [`./scripts/check_hosts.sh`](scripts/check_hosts.sh) to append reachability and Proxmox inventory to [`DISCOVERY_VMS.md`](DISCOVERY_VMS.md). Override hosts with `CHECK_HOSTS="host1 host2"` and use `SSH_BIN`/`SSH_OPTS` if needed. To log elsewhere, set `DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH=<path>`.
- Mocked dry-run (no network): `SSH_BIN=./scripts/mock/ssh CHECK_HOSTS="root@mock" DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH=/tmp/discovery_vms_mock ./scripts/check_hosts.sh`
- Capture VM screenshots: `./scripts/capture_vm_screenshots.sh` (override hosts with `CHECK_HOSTS`, change image directory with `SCREENSHOT_DIR`, snapshot path with `DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS_PATH`).
- Build beamer & GIF snapshot from screenshots: `./scripts/render_vm_slides.sh` or `make vm-slides` (uses `DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md`).
- Storage discovery: [`./scripts/discover_storages.sh`](scripts/discover_storages.sh) (override hosts with `CHECK_HOSTS`, log path with `DISCOVERY_STORAGES_PATH`).
- ISO discovery: [`./scripts/discover_isos.sh`](scripts/discover_isos.sh) (override hosts with `CHECK_HOSTS`, search roots with `ISO_SEARCH_PATHS`, depth with `ISO_MAXDEPTH`, and log path with `DISCOVERY_ISOS_PATH`).
- Port discovery: [`./scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh`](scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh) (override hosts with `CHECK_HOSTS`, adjust `NMAP_TOP_PORTS`, log path with `DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS_PATH`; requires `nmap` on hosts).

## Media
![check_hosts run](media/check_hosts.gif)
![VM screenshots (snapshot)](media/vm_screenshots.gif)

payload.text:
**Preparing discovery documentation and automation**

I’m planning to summarize discovery functions in SKILLS.md with references to key submodule scripts and docs, cover hosts, VMs, ports, storages, ISOs, and screenshots, then update AGENTS.md with recursive submodule checkout steps. I’ll add a makefile target for full discovery running submodule scripts carefully—considering mock SSH and network restrictions in CI—and create a GitHub action VHS tape that uses a Docker container to run discovery workflow with mocks to avoid real network access. I’ll review scripts like discover_vm_ports.sh to ensure compatibility.

summary.text:

I’m planning to summarize discovery functions in SKILLS.md with references to key submodule scripts and docs, cover hosts, VMs, ports, storages, ISOs, and screenshots, then update AGENTS.md with recursive submodule checkout steps. I’ll add a makefile target for full discovery running submodule scripts carefully—considering mock SSH and network restrictions in CI—and create a GitHub action VHS tape that uses a Docker container to run discovery workflow with mocks to avoid real network access. I’ll review scripts like discover_vm_ports.sh to ensure compatibility.

"$SSH_BIN" "${ssh_opts[@]}" "$host" "echo ok" >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo " - Unreachable (SSH failed)." { echo "| $host | $ssh_status | $node_name | $note |" echo } >> "$log_file" continue fi ssh_status="✅ reachable" remote_script=$(cat <<'EOS' set -euo pipefail TOP_PORTS="${TOP_PORTS:-50}" HOST_LABEL="${HOST_LABEL:-unknown}" node="$(hostname)" if ! command -v nmap >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "__STATUS__ NODE=${node} NMAP=missing" exit 0 fi NEIGH="$(ip -4 neigh show | sed -En 's/^([0-9.]+).*lladdr ([0-9a-f:]+).*/\1|\2/p')" lookup_ips_for_macs() { local mac neigh_line local mac_l mac_l="$(echo "$1" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')" echo "$NEIGH" | awk -F'|' -v m="$mac_l" 'tolower($2)==m {print $1}' | sort -u } format_ports() { local ip="$1" local scan ports_line scan="$(nmap -Pn -T4 --top-ports "$TOP_PORTS" --open -sS -oG - "$ip" 2>/dev/null || true)" ports_line="$(echo "$scan" | awk -F'Ports: ' '/Ports: /{print $2; exit}')" if [ -z "${ports_line:-}" ]; then return 1 fi IFS=',' read -ra entries <<< "$ports_line" local formatted=() for entry in "${entries[@]}"; do entry="$(echo "$entry" | xargs)" [ -z "$entry" ] && continue local port proto svc scheme label url port="$(echo "$entry" | cut -d'/' -f1)" proto="$(echo "$entry" | cut -d'/' -f3)" svc="$(echo "$entry" | cut -d'/' -f5)" scheme="$proto" label="${svc:-$proto}" case "$port" in 22|2222) scheme="ssh"; label="SSH" ;; 80|8080|8000|8888|3000|5000|7000|9000|9200) scheme="http"; label="HTTP" ;; 443|8443|9443|10443) scheme="https"; label="HTTPS" ;; 3389) scheme="rdp"; label="RDP" ;; 53) scheme="dns"; label="DNS" ;; 445|139) scheme="smb"; label="SMB" ;; 59[0-9][0-9]) scheme="vnc"; label="VNC" ;; esac case "$svc" in https|ssl/http*) scheme="https"; label="HTTPS" ;; http|http-alt|http-proxy) scheme="http"; label="HTTP" ;; ssh) scheme="ssh"; label="SSH" ;; esac url="${scheme}://${ip}:${port}" formatted+=("${port}/${proto} (${label}) → ${url}") done if [ "${#formatted[@]}" -eq 0 ]; then return 1 fi (IFS='
'; echo "${formatted[*]}") } extract_qemu_ips() { local vmid="$1" node="$2" local raw ips raw="$(pvesh get "/nodes/${node}/qemu/${vmid}/agent/network-get-interfaces" 2>/dev/null || true)" [ -z "$raw" ] && return 1 ips="$(echo "$raw" | python3 - <<'PY' import json, sys try: data = json.load(sys.stdin) except Exception: sys.exit(0) seen = set() for iface in data: for addr in iface.get("ip-addresses", []): if addr.get("ip-address-type") != "ipv4": continue ip = addr.get("ip-address") if not ip or ip.startswith("127."): continue if ip in seen: continue seen.add(ip) print(ip) PY )" [ -z "$ips" ] && return 1 echo "$ips" } extract_lxc_ips() { local vmid="$1" pct exec "$vmid" -- sh -c "ip -4 -o addr show scope global | awk '{print \$4}' | cut -d/ -f1" 2>/dev/null || true } echo "__STATUS__ NODE=${node} NMAP=present" echo "### 🖥️ ${HOST_LABEL} — Port scan (top ${TOP_PORTS} TCP ports)" echo "| 🧩 Guest | 📦 Type | 🌐 IP | 🔓 Open ports |" echo "| --- | --- | --- | --- |" have_rows=0 if command -v qm >/dev/null 2>&1; then while IFS='|' read -r vmid name; do [ -z "${vmid:-}" ] && continue name="${name:-vm-${vmid}}" ips="$(extract_qemu_ips "$vmid" "$node" || true)" if [ -z "${ips:-}" ]; then macs="$(qm config "$vmid" | grep -E '^net[0-9]+:' | grep -oE '([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}' | sort -u || true)" if [ -n "${macs:-}" ]; then while IFS='|' read -r vmid name; do [ -z "${vmid:-}" ] && continue name="${name:-lxc-${vmid}}" ips="$(extract_lxc_ips "$vmid" || true)" if [ -z "${ips:-}" ]; then echo "| ${name} (${vmid}) | 📦 LXC | — (no IP found) | — |" have_rows=1 continue fi while IFS= read -r ip; do [ -z "$ip" ] && continue ports="$(format_ports "$ip" || true)" [ -z "${ports:-}" ] && ports="—" echo "| ${name} (${vmid}) | 📦 LXC | ${ip} | ${ports} |" have_rows=1 done <<< "$ips" done < <(pct list 2>/dev/null | awk 'NR>1 && $2=="running"{print $1 "|" $4}') fi if [ "$have_rows" -eq 0 ]; then echo "| — | — | — | — |" fi EOS ) remote_output="$("$SSH_BIN" "${ssh_opts[@]}" "$host" "TOP_PORTS=$top_ports HOST_LABEL='$host' bash -s" <<< "$remote_script" || true)" status_line="$(echo "$remote_output" | head -n1)" details="$(echo "$remote_output" | tail -n +2)" node_name="$(echo "$status_line" | awk -F'NODE=' '{print $2}' | awk '{print $1}')" if [[ "$status_line" == *"NMAP=missing"* ]]; then note="nmap missing on host; install to scan" details="> nmap not found on $host — skipped port scan." else note="Scan complete (top ${top_ports} TCP ports)"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Mock ssh for CI/testing; interprets commands to emulate Proxmox responses.

# Skip over options
while [[ "$1" == -* ]]; do
  shift
done

host="${1:-}"
shift || true
cmd="$*"

case "$cmd" in
  *"echo ok"*)
    echo "ok"
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"command -v pvesh"* )
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"qm list"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
       VMID NAME                 STATUS     MEM(MB)    BOOTDISK(GB) PID
        101 mockvm101            running    1024              10.00 4242
        102 mockvm102            stopped    2048              20.00 0
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"pct list"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
       VMID STATUS     LOCK         NAME
        201 running                 mocklxc201
        202 stopped                mocklxc202
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"df -hT"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
Filesystem     Type      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
udev           devtmpfs  1.9G     0  1.9G   0% /dev
tmpfs          tmpfs     394M  1.2M  393M   1% /run
/dev/sda1      ext4      100G   40G   56G  42% /
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"lsblk -f"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
NAME   FSTYPE LABEL UUID                                 MOUNTPOINT
sda                                                      
├─sda1 ext4         1234-ABCD                            /
└─sda2 swap         5678-EFGH                            
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"pvesm status"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
Name          Type     Status     Total     Used        Available %
local         dir      active 100000000 40000000 60000000 40.00%
local-lvm     lvmthin  active 200000000 80000000 120000000 40.00%
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"qm screenshot"*|*"screendump"* )
    # Return a tiny 1x1 red PPM image (base64 encoded)
    echo "UDMKMSAxCjI1NQoyNTUgMCAwCg=="
    exit 0
    ;;
  *"find "*".iso"*|*"find "*".img"*|*"find "*".qcow2"*|*"find "*".vmdk"*|*"find "*".vdi"* )
    cat <<'EOF'
/var/lib/vz/template/iso/mock1.iso	102400 KB
/var/lib/vz/template/iso/mock2.img	204800 KB
EOF
    exit 0
    ;;
  *)
    # Default: succeed quietly
    exit 0
    ;;
esac

payload.text:
**Planning full discovery integration and CI workflow**

I’m thinking through adding a Makefile target for “full discovery” that runs submodule scripts locally with a mock SSH environment to avoid network calls; this will be useful in the VHS tape demo and CI workflow. I also plan to add a `submodules` target to manage recursive git submodule checkout, update AGENTS.md with that requirement, and create a GitHub Actions workflow invoking the discovery tape using `vhs-action`. I’m considering SSH key issues in the workflow for submodule checkout via SSH and how to handle outputs and dependencies cleanly without altering the submodule itself. Let’s check the submodule Makefile next to see how best to invoke its scripts.

I also plan to add a `submodules` target to manage recursive git submodule checkout, update AGENTS.md with that requirement, and create a GitHub Actions workflow invoking the discovery tape using `vhs-action`. I’m considering SSH key issues in the workflow for submodule checkout via SSH and how to handle outputs and dependencies cleanly without altering the submodule itself. Let’s check the submodule Makefile next to see how best to invoke its scripts.

DOCKER ?= docker
LATEX_IMG ?= blang/latex:ubuntu
DOCS := docs/gamepad_mapping.pdf docs/gamepad_cheatsheet.pdf docs/repo_guide.pdf
VM_TEX := docs/vm_screenshots.tex
VM_PDF := docs/vm_screenshots.pdf
VM_GIF := media/vm_screenshots.gif

.PHONY: pdfs pdf pull-latex-image

pdfs: $(DOCS)

pdf: pdfs

pull-latex-image:
	@$(DOCKER) pull $(LATEX_IMG)

docs/%.pdf: docs/%.tex
	$(DOCKER) run --rm -v "$(PWD)":/workspace -w /workspace/docs $(LATEX_IMG) latexmk -pdf $(notdir $<)

.PHONY: vm-slides
vm-slides: $(VM_GIF)

$(VM_TEX) $(VM_PDF) $(VM_GIF): DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md scripts/render_vm_slides.sh
	./scripts/render_vm_slides.sh

payload.text:
**Designing full discovery workflow and integration**

I'm mapping out adding a `discovery-full` Makefile target that runs the thinkpadkali1dotfiles submodule's discovery scripts in sequence with configurable output paths and environment variables, plus a related GitHub action and VHS tape to demo it, while managing output directories carefully to avoid polluting the submodule and updating README, AGENTS.md, SKILLS.md, and gitignore accordingly.

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: Makefile
@@
 ACT ?= act
 ACT_FLAGS ?=
 ACT_PLATFORMS ?= -P ubuntu-latest=ghcr.io/catthehacker/ubuntu:act-latest
+DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR ?= discovery
+DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/DISCOVERY_VMS.md
+DISCOVERY_STORAGES_PATH ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/DISCOVERY_STORAGES.md
+DISCOVERY_ISOS_PATH ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/DISCOVERY_ISOS.md
+DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS_PATH ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS.md
+DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS_PATH ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md
+SCREENSHOT_DIR ?= $(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)/vm_screenshots
 
-.PHONY: actions-install actions-list actions-test actions-vhs actions-run
+.PHONY: actions-install actions-list actions-test actions-vhs actions-run actions-discovery submodules discovery-full
+
+submodules:
+	git submodule update --init --recursive
 
 actions-install:
 	./scripts/install-act.sh
 
 actions-list:
 	$(ACT) -l
 
-actions-test:
+actions-test: submodules
 	$(ACT) -n -W .github/workflows/vhs.yml $(ACT_PLATFORMS) $(ACT_FLAGS)
 
-actions-vhs:
+actions-vhs: submodules
 	$(ACT) -W .github/workflows/vhs.yml -j record $(ACT_PLATFORMS) $(ACT_FLAGS)
 
-actions-run: actions-vhs
+actions-discovery: submodules
+	$(ACT) -W .github/workflows/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.yml -j record $(ACT_PLATFORMS) $(ACT_FLAGS)
+
+discovery-full: submodules
+	@mkdir -p "$(DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR)" "$(SCREENSHOT_DIR)"
+	DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH="$(DISCOVERY_VMS_PATH)" ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/check_hosts.sh
+	DISCOVERY_STORAGES_PATH="$(DISCOVERY_STORAGES_PATH)" ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_storages.sh
+	DISCOVERY_ISOS_PATH="$(DISCOVERY_ISOS_PATH)" ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_isos.sh
+	DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS_PATH="$(DISCOVERY_VMS_PORTS_PATH)" ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh
+	SCREENSHOT_DIR="$(SCREENSHOT_DIR)" DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS_PATH="$(DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS_PATH)" ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/capture_vm_screenshots.sh
+
+actions-run: actions-vhs
*** End Patch

 - At the start of each new conversation, open and summarize `NEXT_STEPS.md` before taking any action.
+- Before running discovery or VHS workflows, run `git submodule update --init --recursive` (or `make submodules`).

payload.arguments:
{"command":"cat <<'EOF' > /home/deck/SKILLS.md
# Skills

## thinkpadkali1dotfiles discovery
- Host reachability and Proxmox inventory discovery: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/check_hosts.sh` (documented in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/README.md`).
- VM and LXC inventory logs: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/DISCOVERY_VMS.md` with workflow notes in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/AGENTS.md.d/checking-discovered-proxmox-hosts-vms-and-lxcs.md`.
- Storage discovery: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_storages.sh` (described in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/README.md`).
- ISO and image discovery: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_isos.sh` (described in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/README.md`).
- VM port discovery: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/discover_vm_ports.sh` (described in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/README.md`).
- VM screenshot capture: `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/capture_vm_screenshots.sh` with outputs referenced in `thinkpadkali1dotfiles/DISCOVERY_VMS_SCREENSHOTS.md`.
EOF","workdir":"/home/deck"}

payload.name: shell_command
payload.arguments:
{"command":"cat <<'EOF' > /home/deck/.github/workflows/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.yml
name: ThinkpadKali1 Discovery VHS

on:
  push:
    paths:
      - ".github/workflows/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.yml"
      - ".github/vhs/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.tape"
      - "Makefile"
      - "README.md"
      - ".gitmodules"
      - "assets/**"
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  record:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout (with submodules)
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          submodules: recursive
          ssh-key: ${{ secrets.THINKPADKALI1DOTFILES_DEPLOY_KEY }}

      - name: Record discovery demo with VHS
        uses: charmbracelet/vhs-action@v2
        env:
          CHECK_HOSTS: root@mock
          SSH_BIN: ./thinkpadkali1dotfiles/scripts/mock/ssh
          DISCOVERY_OUTPUT_DIR: discovery
        with:
          tape: .github/vhs/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.tape

      - name: Commit updated discovery GIF
        uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v5
        with:
          commit_message: "Update discovery VHS recording"
          file_pattern: assets/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.gif
EOF","workdir":"/home/deck"}

**Preparing final summary and next steps**

I’m gathering a concise final message that summarizes the key changes like adding a git submodule with SSH deploy key secrets, new Makefile targets, and workflow updates; then I’ll highlight the NEXT_STEPS.md instructions and suggest actionable next steps such as adding secrets and running discovery commands, while noting tests were not run.

summary.text:
**Preparing final summary and next steps**

I’m gathering a concise final message that summarizes the key changes like adding a git submodule with SSH deploy key secrets, new Makefile targets, and workflow updates; then I’ll highlight the NEXT_STEPS.md instructions and suggest actionable next steps such as adding secrets and running discovery commands, while noting tests were not run.

payload.message:
NEXT_STEPS.md summary: local Actions flow depends on restoring DNS so `github.com` resolves; once fixed, run the `make actions-*` targets and push (already pushed here).

Added the `thinkpadkali1dotfiles` submodule (SSH URL) and wired recursive submodule setup into `Makefile` and `AGENTS.md`, then introduced a full-discovery workflow, tape, and README demo. The new `discovery-full` target orchestrates the submodule’s discovery scripts into a single run, while the new VHS action records a second GIF (`assets/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.gif`) and auto-commits it; the workflow checks out submodules via `THINKPADKALI1DOTFILES_DEPLOY_KEY` to support SSH. I also added `SKILLS.md` to summarize discovery capabilities with direct references into the submodule.

Notable files:
- `Makefile`
- `AGENTS.md`
- `README.md`
- `SKILLS.md`
- `.github/workflows/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.yml`
- `.github/vhs/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.tape`
- `.gitmodules`
- `thinkpadkali1dotfiles`

Suggestions:
1) Add the `THINKPADKALI1DOTFILES_DEPLOY_KEY` secret so the new workflow can fetch the SSH submodule.  
2) Run `make submodules` then `make discovery-full` to verify the full discovery locally.  
3) Run `make actions-discovery` (or trigger the workflow) to generate the new GIF.

content.text:
NEXT_STEPS.md summary: local Actions flow depends on restoring DNS so `github.com` resolves; once fixed, run the `make actions-*` targets and push (already pushed here).

Added the `thinkpadkali1dotfiles` submodule (SSH URL) and wired recursive submodule setup into `Makefile` and `AGENTS.md`, then introduced a full-discovery workflow, tape, and README demo. The new `discovery-full` target orchestrates the submodule’s discovery scripts into a single run, while the new VHS action records a second GIF (`assets/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.gif`) and auto-commits it; the workflow checks out submodules via `THINKPADKALI1DOTFILES_DEPLOY_KEY` to support SSH. I also added `SKILLS.md` to summarize discovery capabilities with direct references into the submodule.

Notable files:
- `Makefile`
- `AGENTS.md`
- `README.md`
- `SKILLS.md`
- `.github/workflows/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.yml`
- `.github/vhs/thinkpadkali1dotfiles-discovery.tape`
- `.gitmodules`
- `thinkpadkali1dotfiles`

Suggestions:
1) Add the `THINKPADKALI1DOTFILES_DEPLOY_KEY` secret so the new workflow can fetch the SSH submodule.  
2) Run `make submodules` then `make discovery-full` to verify the full discovery locally.  
3) Run `make actions-discovery` (or trigger the workflow) to generate the new GIF.
